newsitem.title: BAHRAIN: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - May 29.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Saudi newspapers - May 29.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Saudi Arabian press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Japan has launched a new training programme for 75 Saudi government officials, a Japanese official said.
- Land prices rise as demand in eastern province increases.
- Saudi Industrial Services Company to build a 155 million water plant in Riyadh.
- A training workshop aimed at encouraging Saudi women to embark on new business ventures held in Jeddah.
- Saudi King Fahd donates 20 million pounds to the Islamic centre for studies at Oxford university.
- Around 700 mining exploration licenses have been issued in Saudi, oil minister says.
- More than 121 shopping malls in the Saudi capital Riyadh complain of recession, study.
